item.title: Coffee on campus
item.author: Vicky Jeyaprakash,
item.description: I was going to dazzle you all with a review of a restaurant this week but seeing the almost prolific response we received to our coffee article last week I thought I would join in with the conversation. It seems when it comes to our caffeinated sustenance we all have rather exacting standards and I …

item.title: Best in Class: Teen
item.author: Vicky Jeyaprakash,
item.description: There is no shame, only greatness and beautiful people. At least that’s the cover I’m hiding under. Teen Drama has a bad reputation and for good reason; the word teen conjures up an image of a thirteen year old girl painting her nails and blue tacking pictures of some floppy haired, half clothed …

item.title: Our HBO-fest continues
item.author: Vicky Jeyaprakash,Navid Nabijou,
item.description: The Sopranos “A rich exploration of the paradoxes of modern life that will leave an impression on all who give it a chance.” Perhaps no other series to date has had a greater impact on television as The Sopranos, writes Navid Nabijou. Exploding onto the airwaves in 1999, it came as a massive shock; …

item.title: National Television Awards
item.author: Vicky Jeyaprakash,
item.description: Tis’ the season. Award ceremonies are everywhere as the ultimate narcissists congratulate themselves on just how wonderful they are. I don’t know about you but that’s my idea of a fun night in. I love the red carpet, the utter rubbish people say about how grateful they are for the free booze and …

item.title: So you think you can eat? Meet the meat challenge
item.author: Vicky Jeyaprakash,
item.description: Meat. That quintessential ingredient of all meals. The point of any fare. Or so I’ve been told. I love food; lunch, brunch, pudding, tea, tapas and amuse-bouche are all held in fond regard. I could however easily forgo meat. I’m not a vegetarian. I would definitely not want to be part of that fringe …

item.title: 10 O’Clock Live premier: Confused
item.author: Vicky Jeyaprakash,
item.description: In the last month Channel 4’s marketing department has done well in bombarding us all with anchormanesque billboards and amusing adverts for 10 O’Clock Live, their new topical comedy show. I suspect, however, that the hype and anticipation created is where their downfall will lie. All of us were far …
